I would switch to a diet of animal products: Meat, poultry, fish, and dairy products are all great sources of essential vitamins and minerals. For example, red meat is high in vitamin B12, while salmon is an excellent source of omega-3 fatty acids and vitamin D.

I would take supplements: There are a variety of vitamin and mineral supplements available that can help me get the nutrients I need. However, it's important to talk to a doctor or registered dietitian before taking any supplements, as they can help ensure that I'm getting the right amount of nutrients in a safe and effective way.

I would incorporate more whole grains and legumes into my diet: Whole grains and legumes are both good sources of essential vitamins and minerals. For example, brown rice is high in B vitamins, while lentils are a good source of iron and folate.

I would eat more nuts and seeds: Nuts and seeds are both high in healthy fats and a good source of essential vitamins and minerals. For example, almonds are a good source of vitamin E, while chia seeds are high in omega-3 fatty acids and a good source of iron.

I would eat more fortified foods: Many foods are now fortified with essential vitamins and minerals to help people get the nutrients they need. For example, many breakfast cereals are fortified with vitamins and minerals, making them a convenient and easy way to get the nutrients I need.
